Description: Terracotta figure of woman. A fat naked female being with legs raised on each side to expose her genitals: she holds her left leg up with her left hand and indicates her pubic area with her right hand. She looks down to her right; tresses of her hair fall on her shoulders and she wears a tightly bound wreath. There is summary working on her back, and a suspension-lug is applied behind her neck. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt; minute traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Close: My´sliwiec 2004b: b&w plate [16], from Athribis, dated Ptolemaic. Near: Vogt 1924: pl. C:3; Török 1995: no. 189. Bibliog. Fischer 1994: 337, no. 832.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3136)
Condition: Her right leg and her left foot are lost and the suspension-lug is damaged.
